entry.value: More control schemes are available in the options menu. You can also define your own scheme and customise the controls there.
Press left mouse button to buy this ability
F11: hide console; help: command list
Defines player movement. When switched on the movement is parallel to the screen edges, when switched off it is relative to the player's orientation.
When turned on the player will look toward mouse cursor - a useful option when you play with the mouse.
Allows the player to cast known spells with mouse gestures. When special button is pressed, four runes appear on the screen - they are selectable by mouse and can be used to cast a sequence spell.
Allows the player to cast known spells with two separate sets of keys - one for sequences and one for slots.

Congratulations!
You have managed to slay the evil dragon and his demonic minions. You are victorious! You have saved the king, kingdom, and all the maidens in Wolfden. On the spur of the moment the grateful citizens are building you a monument and a tower. The future seems to be in bright colours...
That's all we have prepared for you in this release. We hope you enjoyed our game.
Stay tuned!
Drag ability to a bar at the bottom to use it in combat.
File data/config.xml file doesn't contain any control schemes. Please update it, or make your own scheme.

Do you want to run Warlock's Gauntlet in fullscreen mode? If you select OK, game will start in fullscreen mode %dx%d. If you select Cancel, game will start in windowed mode 800x600. Remember, you can always change fullscreen mode and resolution in options menu.
The ability screen on your left is used for learning and enhancing spells - click on the icons to view descriptions or to buy the next level.
Help screen: - Player 1: %ls - Player 2: %ls Ability screen: - Player 1: %ls - Player 2: %ls F11 - console window
You have earned a skill point!
Press F1 for controls and spell list.
Press F2 to buy new spells.

Have you ever played Gauntlet, Get Medieval, Diablo, GTA or Crimsonland? Conceptually Warlock's Gauntlet is a compilation of game mechanics used in those titles with a few original improvements.
You are a battle mage. Not an ordinary one - you are the biggest daredevil among battle mages. On your way stand hordes of evil, demonic and completely stupid monsters. You have to kick their asses and show them who is the master. Don't worry about the saving the world, or rescuing the princess - your only goal is to find the green gateway leading to the next level full of new monsters (and remember to kick their asses too!).
You will have at your disposal over 50 unique spells (that can be found in the hidden chests or can be dropped by a slain monster). From time to time you will earn a new level allowing you to boost your current spells so you can kick even more asses. But beware - you may encounter evil bosses which will smite you to the pieces in a single punch! Be careful not to get killed, or else you will have to start current level from the beginning.

Drag & drop an item to move it into another slot.
This slot is empty - you can put any of your items here.
